author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> so I am running now a beam sync on mainnet, the way it was envisioned by Jason and Piper (with the background state sync)

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> if you would like to try it out I suggest waiting for some 1.8.10 or higher Nethermind version

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> I will let you know when we enable it by default on mainnet syncs

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> I am now at the stage of collecting ideas to actually make it more efficient (now it may have block gaps on mainnet while syncing)

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> any witness format would be immediately usable and I mentioned in the past the naive witness (not really a wtiness, more like a helper) of a list of node hashes for GetNodeData calls

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> we may add it to Nethermind as this would be of much smaller size and should be downloadable in milliseconds during the sync if received from peers

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> (both the witness and actual data)

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> I am thinking of multiple prefetcher in case the witness is not available - txpool, parallel tx executors and so on but so far it seems like it would be more work and complexity than benefit for the users

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> to get any usable data to experiment with we would probably need Geth or Parity to support some iind of witnesses

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> I think that holding a witness for last 128 blovks or similar would be enough to provide a great experience on the way to iur stateless goal

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> one thing, I think, you probably mentioned that, would be useful - to include a list of touched accounts in the witness

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> we could do that by using account addresses instead of trie paths and for each trie path we could just include the range of the path from the address hash

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> then we do not add extra space overhead (we even save space by using 20 bytes address instead of 32 byte hash)

author: eth2_gitter_bot
content: <tkstanczak> and we can allow clients to download the witnessed a build a turbo geth style indocea for accounts
